interlinear-text.item: Told in 1967, 1968, 1969, 1972 by Akbarcho Soultanov, 50-55 years old, schoolmaster in the village of Zmoudg, and in 1968 by Andalieb Kourbounassinov, 40 years old, from the village of Vrang, and by Chabozkhon Karakouchiev, 40 years old, Kolhozian from the village of Langar.

phrase.item: A man with a small head and big bottom.
botch is a ritual meat and crushed wheat stew, qemoch is a bread that is baked for the spring equinox
It’s better to get drunk than to brag about one’s fortune.
It’s good to imitate other people and to work like they do.
If it doesn't come through the affection of Ali, then it comes through the force of Ali.
About old people’s attachment to their home country.
Batt is a fruit jam with added wheat which fills you up quickly. It is considered rude to refuse any food other than batt.
This is none of my business.
